page.title: 17THE PEDESTRIAN PRECINCT
page.content: {SHOULD CARS BE ALLOWED ACCESS? The main entrance to the Arndale Shopping Centre is accessible for pedestrians but also cars; young mothers push prams in between moving vehicles in a controversial area that is known as a pedestrian precinct and yet it is heavily used by these cars. Most people who use the Arndale Centre complained bitterly about the danger caused by these cars to shoppers and young children. They claimed that the precinct should either be for them, or for the cars, but not both. One mother stated that the danger on this precinct made a hectic shopping day even worse. On the other hand, the motorists claim that they are legally entitled to use the area to reach the banks,but who is right?
